title: How to Find a Lost PSP

steps.headline: Make sure that it's truly lost.
steps.description: Look around where you are. Are you sitting on it? Is it in the car? Did you go to the bathroom and someone pick it up to look for it? All of these are questions you should ask before you assume your PSP is missing.

steps.headline: Ask if anyone has seen it.
steps.description: Just because it's lost to you doesn't mean that someone else didn't see it! Maybe they can help you.

steps.headline: Go to the place you remember seeing it last.
steps.description: Maybe you set it down in a restaurant and it's still there.

steps.headline: Retrace your steps.
steps.description: Do everything you remember doing after the last time you saw it. Try to mimic the conversations. Every little bit helps.

steps.headline: Stop thinking about it for a few minutes.
steps.description: More often than not it will turn up somewhere the moment you stop actively looking for it.

steps.headline: Could it be in your coat?
steps.description: jacket? friends house? somewhere else? Also look in unusual places you wouldn't expect it to be.

text: Make sure that it's truly lost. Look around where you are. Are you sitting on it? Is it in the car? Did you go to the bathroom and someone pick it up to look for it? All of these are questions you should ask before you assume your PSP is missing. Ask if anyone has seen it. Just because it's lost to you doesn't mean that someone else didn't see it! Maybe they can help you. Go to the place you remember seeing it last. Maybe you set it down in a restaurant and it's still there. Retrace your steps. Do everything you remember doing after the last time you saw it. Try to mimic the conversations. Every little bit helps. Stop thinking about it for a few minutes. More often than not it will turn up somewhere the moment you stop actively looking for it. Could it be in your coat? jacket? friends house? somewhere else? Also look in unusual places you wouldn't expect it to be.
